No prob. I have all these solutions for everyone else, and yet I can't
get my own comp to function :-)


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> I've told him.
> 
> He says thanks  =)
> 
> On 17 Apr 2001, at 3:01, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> 
> > Ok, more info. I just checked out what eGroups says about Jer's
> > status. He has too much stuff on his Yahoo email. Yahoo only allowes 6
> > megs per used, and if he exeeds that (which is what eGroups says is
> > the prob), he can't get more mail. My recommendation is just doing
> > everything from the site and setting him on Web Only/No Mail, but he
> > could also clear out his Yahoo inbox.
> > 
> > PS. I unbounced his bounced status, so if it was just Yahoo messing up
> > and accidently saying that he was over or something, he can post
> > again. If his account is really over 6 megs, then he'll still have to
> > clean it out.
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > > "Email is bouncing messages" means that his mail recieving server
> > > isn't working great, and the messages don't get through and get
> > > "bounced" back at the sending server (which is eGroups in this
case).
> > > The easiest way to solve this is to post straight from the eGroups
> > > site. Its faster, more reliable, and you don't have to rely on your
> > > email that way. Here's how you do it:
> > > 
> > > 1. First, get a Yahoo ID, or if you have one, make sure you know the
> > > ID and pass.
> > > 2. Goto http://groups.yahoo.com/convwiz , fill out your email
address
> > > and eGroups password (if you don't know the egroups password,
fill out
> > > the "forgot password" thing and they'll email you a reactivation
> > > number which you can use to change your pass from the site.
After you
> > > fill out your email and pass, it'll ask you for your Yahoo ID
and the
> > > password for it, and you fill that out too. Follow whatever
additional
> > > instructions it throws at you, and you should have your email linked
> > > to your ID.
> > > 3. Log into your email through eGroups at
> > > http://groups.yahoo.com/login.cgi .
> > > 4. There should be a link called NBWRPG on the left side of the page
> > > you get after logging in, under the "My Groups" section. Click
on it.
> > > 5. When the main eGroups page for NBW loads up, click on the
> > > "Messages" link to the left. You can read messages and reply to them
> > > from the site, as well as start new posts, and vote in the polls.
> > > 
> > > You can also skip steps 4 and 5 by going straight to
> > > http://egroups.com/messages/nbwrpg
> > > 
> > > 
> > > An alternate solution is to just wait for the mail server to get
> > > better, which can take quite a while.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> > > > Jer wanted me to ask ppl what "email is bouncing messages" 
> > > > mean because he can't post (again) due to that error, and he  
> > > > doesn't know how to solve it. Anyone have any input?
> > 
> > 
> >  
> > 
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/ 
> > 
> >
